September 10 at 12:13 PM ·

Congratulations to our 2020 "Ruby Award for Women Helping Women" winners! Frazer Elementary teachers Jessy Tsoufiou and Maggie O’Brian co-founded the Fierce Females in Fall 2018. The confidence and kindness-building program for fourth grade girls embraces the motto, “Learn, Lead, and Love.” Students participate in service projects and lessons to build confidence in their abilities and make them less troubled by peer pressure and social environments. Professional women from across the country present powerful messages to the group. Emphasis is placed on spreading kindness and the importance of giving back. Daily, the girls empower each other by supporting one another as they work to achieve their goals.

Help us celebrate Jessy and Maggie at our Virtual Celebration of Women event on Thursday September 17th, 2020. Registration for the FREE event is available now at www.bestforwomencanton.org or www.tinyurl.com/virtualeachforequal

Parents: bus routes are loaded online in e-link! Instructions to log in were mailed home to all families last week.

Additionally, they are listed below. Here is how to get logged in to view your child's bus information:

-Visit the website https://tinyurl.com/PLSBUS
-First time logging in, your user name and password are the same.
-They are your child’s first and last name in the format firstname.lastname (Example: Student name is Samantha Johnson - username and password = samantha.johnson)
-Click Login
-You will be prompted to change your password on initial login
-Click “Work with Students”
-Click “View My Students” then click the name of your child
-Click “View PDF”

In the event that you find incorrect or partially correct pick-up or drop-off information, please contact the transportation office at 330-492-1918.

#PLSReturnToLearn

I am a product of and have spent my career in public education. To me, it's a place where all are welcome and where anyone can be successful. The kids who will be left behind are the ones that need our help the most. We have to protect them and their right to a quality education.

-Proof of residency such as an electric bill, rental agreement, home purchase agreement, etc.
-Student’s birth certificate
-Student’s immunization records
-Custody paperwork if applicable
